query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 La gloria di colui che tutto move 2 per l’universo penetra, e risplende 3 in una parte più e meno altrove.
query.result:
**English:**
1 The glory of Him who moves everything 2 penetrates the universe, and shines 3 more in one part and less in another.
**Malay:**
1 Kemuliaan Dia yang menggerakkan segalanya 2 menembus alam semesta, dan bersinar 3 lebih banyak di satu bagian dan lebih sedikit di bagian lain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Veramente quant’ io del regno santo 11 ne la mia mente potei far tesoro, 12 sarà ora materia del mio canto.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Truly, as much as I was able to treasure in my mind 11 of the holy realm, 12 will now be the subject of my song.
**Malay:**
10 Sungguh, sebanyak yang dapat kusimpan dalam pikiranku 11 tentang alam suci, 12 akan menjadi bahan nyanyianku sekarang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 O buono Appollo, a l’ultimo lavoro 14 fammi del tuo valor sì fatto vaso, 15 come dimandi a dar l’amato alloro.
query.result:
**English:**
13 O good Apollo, for the final labor 14 make me a vessel of your worth, 15 as I asked when I desired the beloved laurel.
**Malay:**
13 Wahai Apollo yang baik, untuk pekerjaan terakhir 14 jadikanlah aku bejana yang berharga, 15 sebagaimana yang kuminta ketika menginginkan pohon laurel yang dicintai.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Infino a qui l’un giogo di Parnaso 17 assai mi fu; ma or con amendue 18 m’è uopo intrar ne l’aringo rimaso.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Up to this point, one peak of Parnassus 17 was enough for me; but now with both 18 I must enter the remaining arena.
**Malay:**
16 Hingga saat ini, satu puncak Parnassus 17 sudah cukup bagiku; tetapi sekarang dengan keduanya 18 aku harus memasuki gelanggang yang tersisa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
19 Entra nel petto mio, e spira tue 20 sì come quando Marsïa traesti 21 de la vagina de le membra sue.
query.result:
**English:**
19 Enter my breast, and breathe into it 20 just as when you pulled Marsyas 21 from the sheath of his limbs.
**Malay:**
19 Masuklah ke dalam dadaku, dan hembuskanlah 20 seperti ketika kau menarik Marsyas 21 dari sarung anggota tubuhnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 O divina virtù, se mi ti presti 23 tanto che l’ombra del beato regno 24 segnata nel mio capo io manifesti,
25 vedra’mi al piè del tuo diletto legno 26 venire, e coronarmi de le foglie 27 che la materia e tu mi farai degno.
query.result:
**English:**
22 O divine virtue, if you grant me 23 so much that the shadow of the blessed kingdom 24 imprinted in my mind I manifest,
25 you will see me at the foot of your beloved tree 26 come, and crown myself with the leaves 27 that matter and you will make me worthy.
**Malay:**
22 Wahai kebajikan ilahi, jika Engkau memberiku 23 begitu banyak sehingga bayangan kerajaan yang diberkati 24 terpatri dalam pikiranku aku nyatakan,
25 Engkau akan melihatku di kaki pohon kesayangan-Mu 26 datang, dan memahkotai diriku dengan dedaunan 27 yang materi dan Engkau akan membuatku layak.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Sì rade volte, padre, se ne coglie 29 per trïunfare o cesare o poeta, 30 colpa e vergogna de l’umane voglie,
31 che parturir letizia in su la lieta 32 delfica deïtà dovria la fronda 33 peneia, quando alcun di sé asseta.
query.result:
**English:**
28 So rarely, father, is it gathered 29 for triumph, by either Caesar or poet, 30 the fault and shame of human desires,
31 that the Peneian laurel, when someone is crowned with it, 32 ought to produce joy on the joyful brow 33 of the Delphic deity.
**Malay:**
28 Begitu jarang, bapa, ia dipetik 29 untuk kemenangan, baik oleh Kaisar atau penyair, 30 kesalahan dan aib keinginan manusia,
31 sehingga pohon salam Peneian, ketika seseorang dimahkotai dengannya, 32 seharusnya menghasilkan kegembiraan di dahi yang gembira 33 dari dewa Delphic.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Poca favilla gran fiamma seconda: 35 forse di retro a me con miglior voci 36 si pregherà perché Cirra risponda.
query.result:
**English:**
34 A small spark can start a great flame: 35 perhaps behind me, with better voices, 36 prayers will be said for Cirra to answer.
**Malay:**
34 Percikan kecil dapat menyalakan api besar: 35 mungkin di belakangku, dengan suara yang lebih baik, 36 doa akan dipanjatkan agar Cirra menjawab.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Surge ai mortali per diverse foci 38 la lucerna del mondo; ma da quella 39 che quattro cerchi giugne con tre croci,
40 con miglior corso e con migliore stella 41 esce congiunta, e la mondana cera 42 più a suo modo tempera e suggella.
query.result:
**English:**
37 The lamp of the world rises for mortals from different foci; but from that 38 which joins four circles with three crosses, 39 with a better course and with a better star 40 it comes forth conjoined, and the worldly wax 41 it tempers and seals more to its own fashion.
**Malay:**
37 Lampu dunia terbit bagi manusia dari berbagai fokus; tetapi dari fokus 38 yang menggabungkan empat lingkaran dengan tiga salib, 39 dengan perjalanan yang lebih baik dan dengan bintang yang lebih baik 40 ia muncul bersama, dan lilin duniawi 41 ia bentuk dan segel lebih sesuai dengan caranya sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Fatto avea di là mane e di qua sera 44 tal foce, e quasi tutto era là bianco 45 quello emisperio, e l’altra parte nera,
46 quando Beatrice in sul sinistro fianco 47 vidi rivolta e riguardar nel sole: 48 aguglia sì non li s’affisse unquanco.
query.result:
**English:**
43 It had made morning there and evening here, 44 at that outlet, and almost the whole of that hemisphere was white, 45 and the other part black,
46 when Beatrice, on my left side, 47 I saw turned and gazing at the sun: 48 never has an eagle fixed itself so intently on it.
**Malay:**
43 Telah menjadi pagi di sana dan petang di sini, 44 di tempat keluar itu, dan hampir seluruh belahan bumi itu putih, 45 dan bagian lainnya hitam,
46 ketika Beatrice, di sisi kiriku, 47 kulihat menoleh dan menatap matahari: 48 tidak pernah ada elang yang menatapnya begitu tajam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 E sì come secondo raggio suole 50 uscir del primo e risalire in suso, 51 pur come pelegrin che tornar vuole,
52 così de l’atto suo, per li occhi infuso 53 ne l’imagine mia, il mio si fece, 54 e fissi li occhi al sole oltre nostr’ uso.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And just as a second ray is wont 50 to issue from the first and rise upward, 51 just like a pilgrim who wants to return,
52 so from his action, infused through the eyes 53 into my image, mine was made, 54 and I fixed my eyes on the sun beyond our custom.
**Malay:**
49 Dan sebagaimana sinar kedua biasanya 50 keluar dari yang pertama dan naik ke atas, 51 persis seperti peziarah yang ingin kembali,
52 demikianlah dari tindakannya, yang diresapi melalui mata 53 ke dalam bayanganku, bayanganku pun terbentuk, 54 dan aku menatap matahari melampaui kebiasaan kita.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 Molto è licito là, che qui non lece 56 a le nostre virtù, mercé del loco 57 fatto per proprio de l’umana spece.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Much is permitted there that is not permitted here 56 to our virtues, thanks to the place 57 made specifically for the human race.
**Malay:**
55 Banyak yang dibenarkan di sana, yang di sini tidak dibenarkan 56 untuk kebaikan kita, berkat tempat itu 57 yang dibuat khusus untuk umat manusia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Beatrice tutta ne l’etterne rote 65 fissa con li occhi stava; e io in lei 66 le luci fissi, di là sù rimote.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Beatrice, all in the crimson robe, 65 stood with her eyes fixed; and I on her, 66 my gaze fixed from up there afar.
**Malay:**
64 Beatrice, seluruhnya dalam jubah merah tua, 65 berdiri dengan matanya yang terpaku; dan aku padanya, 66 tatapanku terpaku dari atas sana yang jauh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Nel suo aspetto tal dentro mi fei, 68 qual si fé Glauco nel gustar de l’erba 69 che ’l fé consorto in mar de li altri dèi.
query.result:
**English:**
67 In its appearance I made myself so within, 68 as Glaucus did in tasting the herb 69 that made him a companion in the sea of the other gods.
**Malay:**
67 Dalam penampilannya aku membuat diriku begitu di dalam, 68 seperti yang dilakukan Glaucus saat mencicipi rumput laut 69 yang membuatnya menjadi sahabat para dewa lainnya di laut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 Trasumanar significar per verba 71 non si poria; però l’essemplo basti 72 a cui esperïenza grazia serba.
query.result:
**English:**
70 To signify transcendence through words 71 is not possible; therefore, the example suffices 72 to which experience grants every grace.
**Malay:**
70 Untuk menandakan transendensi melalui kata-kata 71 tidaklah mungkin; oleh karena itu, contohnya cukup 72 yang kepadanya pengalaman memberikan setiap rahmat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 S’i’ era sol di me quel che creasti 74 novellamente, amor che ’l ciel governi, 75 tu ’l sai, che col tuo lume mi levasti.
query.result:
**English:**
73 If I was alone with that which you created 74 anew, love that governs the heavens, 75 you know it, for with your light you lifted me up.
**Malay:**
73 Jika aku sendirian dengan apa yang Engkau ciptakan 74 baru-baru ini, cinta yang mengatur langit, 75 Engkau tahu itu, karena dengan cahaya-Mu Engkau mengangkatku.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Quando la rota che tu sempiterni 77 desiderato, a sé mi fece atteso 78 con l’armonia che temperi e discerni,
79 parvemi tanto allor del cielo acceso 80 de la fiamma del sol, che pioggia o fiume 81 lago non fece alcun tanto disteso.
query.result:
**English:**
76 When the wheel that you eternally 77 desired, made me awaited for itself 78 with the harmony that you moderate and discern,
79 then it seemed to me that so much of heaven was kindled 80 by the flame of the sun, that no rain or river 81 or lake ever made so vast an expanse.
**Malay:**
76 Ketika roda yang kau abadikan 77 yang diinginkan, membuatku menantikannya 78 dengan harmoni yang kau kendalikan dan bedakan,
79 maka tampaklah bagiku begitu banyak surga yang dinyalakan 80 oleh nyala matahari, sehingga hujan atau sungai 81 atau danau tidak pernah membuat hamparan yang begitu luas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 La novità del suono e ’l grande lume 83 di lor cagion m’accesero un disio 84 mai non sentito di cotanto acume.
query.result:
**English:**
82 The novelty of the sound and the great light 83 of them aroused in me a desire 84 never felt before with such intensity.
**Malay:**
82 Kebaruan bunyi dan cahaya yang terang 83 dari mereka membangkitkan dalam diriku sebuah hasrat 84 yang belum pernah kurasakan sebelumnya dengan intensitas seperti itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Ond’ ella, che vedea me sì com’ io, 86 a quïetarmi l’animo commosso, 87 pria ch’io a dimandar, la bocca aprio
88 e cominciò: «Tu stesso ti fai grosso 89 col falso imaginar, sì che non vedi 90 ciò che vedresti se l’avessi scosso.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Whereupon she, who saw me as I was, 86 to quiet my troubled soul, 87 before I asked, opened her mouth
88 and began: "You yourself make yourself gross 89 with false imagining, so that you do not see 90 what you would see if you had shaken it off.
**Malay:**
85 Di situ, dia yang melihatku sebagaimana adanya aku, 86 untuk menenangkan jiwaku yang gelisah, 87 sebelum aku bertanya, membuka mulutnya
88 dan berkata: "Engkau sendiri membuat dirimu kasar 89 dengan khayalan palsu, sehingga engkau tidak melihat 90 apa yang akan engkau lihat jika engkau telah mengguncangnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 Tu non se’ in terra, sì come tu credi; 92 ma folgore, fuggendo il proprio sito, 93 non corse come tu ch’ad esso riedi».
query.result:
**English:**
91 You are not on earth, as you believe; 92 but lightning, fleeing its own place, 93 did not race as you do, who are returning to it.
**Malay:**
91 Kamu tidak berada di bumi, seperti yang kamu yakini; 92 tetapi petir, yang melarikan diri dari tempatnya sendiri, 93 tidak berlari secepat kamu, yang kembali kepadanya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 S’io fui del primo dubbio disvestito 95 per le sorrise parolette brevi, 96 dentro ad un nuovo più fu’ inretito
97 e dissi: «Già contento requïevi 98 di grande ammirazion; ma ora ammiro 99 com’ io trascenda questi corpi levi».
query.result:
**English:**
94 If I was relieved of my first doubt 95 by the brief, smiling words, 96 I was ensnared even more by a new one
97 and I said: "I was already content and at rest 98 from great wonder; but now I marvel 99 at how I transcend these light bodies".
**Malay:**
94 Jika aku terbebas dari keraguan pertamaku 95 oleh kata-kata singkat yang tersenyum, 96 aku lebih terperangkap oleh yang baru
97 dan aku berkata: "Aku sudah puas dan tenang 98 dari kekaguman yang besar; tetapi sekarang aku heran 99 bagaimana aku melampaui tubuh-tubuh yang ringan ini".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Ond’ ella, appresso d’un pïo sospiro, 101 li occhi drizzò ver’ me con quel sembiante 102 che madre fa sovra figlio deliro,
103 e cominciò: «Le cose tutte quante 104 hanno ordine tra loro, e questo è forma 105 che l’universo a Dio fa simigliante.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Then, with a sigh, 101 she turned her eyes toward me with the expression 102 that a mother gives to her delirious son,
103 and began: “All things have order among themselves, 104 and this is the form 105 that makes the universe resemble God.
**Malay:**
100 Kemudian, dengan desahan, 101 dia mengarahkan matanya ke arahku dengan ekspresi 102 yang diberikan seorang ibu kepada anaknya yang mengigau,
103 dan mulai berkata: “Semua hal memiliki keteraturan di antara mereka, 104 dan inilah bentuk 105 yang membuat alam semesta menyerupai Tuhan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
106 Qui veggion l’alte creature l’orma 107 de l’etterno valore, il qual è fine 108 al quale è fatta la toccata norma.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here the high creatures see the trace 107 of the eternal value, which is the end 108 to which the norm of touch is made.
**Malay:**
106 Di sini makhluk-makhluk agung melihat jejak 107 nilai abadi, yang merupakan tujuan 108 yang menjadi norma sentuhan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Vero è che, come forma non s’accorda 128 molte fïate a l’intenzion de l’arte, 129 perch’ a risponder la materia è sorda,
130 così da questo corso si diparte 131 talor la creatura, c’ha podere 132 di piegar, così pinta, in altra parte;
133 e sì come veder si può cadere 134 foco di nube, sì l’impeto primo 135 l’atterra torto da falso piacere.
query.result:
**English:**
127 It is true that, just as form does not always accord 128 with the intention of the art, 129 because the material is deaf to the response,
130 so too does the creature sometimes depart from this course, 131 who has the power to bend, thus driven, in another direction;
133 and just as one can see fire fall 134 from a cloud, so the first impetus 135 knocks it down crookedly from false pleasure.
**Malay:**
127 Benar bahwa, sebagaimana bentuk tidak selalu sesuai 128 dengan maksud seni, 129 karena bahannya tidak dapat menjawab,
130 demikian juga makhluk terkadang menyimpang dari jalan ini, 131 yang memiliki kekuatan untuk membelokkan, dengan cara didorong, ke arah lain;
133 dan sebagaimana orang dapat melihat api jatuh 134 dari awan, demikian juga dorongan pertama 135 menjatuhkannya secara bengkok karena kesenangan palsu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Non dei più ammirar, se bene stimo, 137 lo tuo salir, se non come d’un rivo 138 se d’alto monte scende giuso ad imo.
query.result:
**English:**
136 You should not marvel more, if I judge correctly, 137 at your ascent, except as at a river 138 that descends from a high mountain to the bottom.
**Malay:**
136 Janganlah kamu kagum lagi, jika aku menilai dengan benar, 137 atas pendakianmu, kecuali seperti sungai 138 yang turun dari gunung yang tinggi ke bawah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Maraviglia sarebbe in te se, privo 140 d’impedimento, giù ti fossi assiso, 141 com’ a terra quïete in foco vivo».
query.result:
**English:**
139 It would be a marvel in you if, deprived 140 of impediment, you had sat down below, 141 as on earth quiet fire sits in live flame».
**Malay:**
139 Sungguh menakjubkan jika engkau, tanpa 140 rintangan, telah duduk di bawah, 141 seperti di bumi api yang tenang berada dalam nyala api yang hidup».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Quinci rivolse inver’ lo cielo il viso.
query.result:
**English:**
142 Then he turned his face toward heaven.
**Malay:**
142 Kemudian dia memalingkan wajahnya ke arah langit.
